security_audit.summary: This skill contains only static markdown documentation extracted from official CCXT sources. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or file system access capabilities are present. The skill provides informational content only.

content.user_title: Get help with CCXT cryptocurrency trading library
content.value_statement: CCXT is a complex library supporting 150+ cryptocurrency exchanges. This skill provides comprehensive documentation and examples for implementing trading APIs, market data retrieval, and automated trading strategies across multiple exchanges.
actual_capabilities: Explain CCXT library architecture and exchange integration patterns
Provide code examples for fetching market data from 150+ exchanges
Help with order placement, management, and cancellation operations
Guide implementation of WebSocket streaming with CCXT Pro
Assist with authentication, API keys, and exchange credentials
Troubleshoot common issues and error handling scenarios
limitations: Does not execute trades or access user exchange accounts directly
Does not provide real-time market data or price feeds
Cannot install or configure the CCXT library on user systems
Reference documentation is static and may not reflect latest exchange changes

output_examples.input: How do I create a market buy order with CCXT?
output: • First check if the exchange supports this feature: exchange.has['createMarketBuyOrderWithCost']
• For exchanges requiring price, set createMarketBuyRequiresPrice option or pass price parameter
• Note: Some exchanges require amount in quote currency (USDT) not base currency (BTC)

best_practices: Always enable rate limiting to avoid exchange API bans: exchange.enableRateLimit = true
Reuse exchange instances throughout your application instead of creating new ones
Load markets once with loadMarkets() before trading to improve performance
Never share API keys or secrets in code examples or support requests
anti_patterns: Creating new exchange instances for each API call (resets rate limiter)
Ignoring rate limits and getting banned from exchange APIs
Forgetting to handle API errors and exceptions in production code
Hardcoding API keys in source code instead of using environment variables

faq.question: Which programming languages does CCXT support?
faq.answer: CCXT supports JavaScript, Python, PHP, and TypeScript. The library works in Node.js and browsers for JavaScript, asyncio for Python, and ReactPHP for PHP.

faq.question: How many exchanges does CCXT support?
faq.answer: CCXT supports over 150 cryptocurrency exchanges. Use exchange.id to get the full list of supported exchange identifiers programmatically.

faq.question: How do I switch to sandbox mode for testing?
faq.answer: Call exchange.setSandboxMode(true) immediately after creating the exchange instance. Sandbox APIs use the same interface but with virtual test funds.

faq.question: Is my API key data safe with CCXT?
faq.answer: CCXT runs locally on your machine. Never share your keys in public forums. Use environment variables or secure key management for credentials.

faq.question: Why am I getting rate limit errors?
faq.answer: Enable the built-in rate limiter with exchange.enableRateLimit = true. Reuse exchange instances and avoid creating new ones frequently.

faq.question: What is the difference between CCXT and CCXT Pro?
faq.answer: CCXT provides REST API access for trading and market data. CCXT Pro adds WebSocket streaming for real-time updates on prices, orders, and trades.
